page.title: 01TOPOGRAPHY/GAZETTEER OF AREA
page.content: The topography of the area is a com- bination of soft rolling hills and flat land. The fields, mainly under grass,are enclosed by hedges and walls constructed of the bed rock,which is limestone, as are most of the build- ings in the three villages of the area listed in the following gazetteer. In STAINTON WITH ADGARLEY the farms and cottages are built around a large green,where a cock fighting ring is still visible. There are two public houses and a limestone quarry. In LITTLE URSWICK the ancient Grammar School and the Inn border the village green along with the farms and cott- ages. There is a garage with work shop and petrol pumps. SCALES is a quiet linear village of cottages and farms. It has a small school and a malt kiln in the centre, and a ruined castle on the outskirts.
